title: How do I connect my phone to a Wi-Fi hotspot with a static IP address to access the Internet?
answer:
Touch Settings > Wireless & networks > Wi-Fi. On the Wi-Fi screen, touch a hotspot. In the displayed dialog box, select Show advanced options. Touch IP settings and select Static. Enter the IP address , gateway address, network prefix length , and domain name (DNS address). 

 ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=111420)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=111421)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=111422)

 ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=111423)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=111424)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=111425)

 ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=111426)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=111427)

 Note: 

 When your phone uses DHCP to access the Internet over Wi-Fi, it must wait for the router to assign it a dynamic IP address, which takes time. By specifying a static IP address for your phone, this issue is resolved.
